metadata.title: CVE-2021-47135 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mt76:mt7921: fix possible AOOB issue in mt7921_mcu_tx_rate_report Fix possiblearray out of bound access in mt7921_mcu_tx_rate_report. Remove unnecessaryvaribable in mt7921_mcu_tx_rate_report

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').

linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').
linux-gke-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2000.4').
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
